## Block-level Content Switching

Here's how to read data from a CSV file:

::: {.content-switcher version="v2026.01"}
## version 2026.01.0 Example {.unlisted}

Use pandas to read CSV data:

```python
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv('data.csv')
print(data.head())
```
:::

::: {.content-switcher version="v2.0"}
### version 2.0 example {.unlisted}

Use readr to read CSV data:

```r
library(readr)
data <- read_csv('data.csv')
head(data)
```
:::

::: {.content-switcher version="v3.0"}
### version 3.0 Example {.unlisted}

Use CSV.jl to read CSV data:

```julia
using CSV, DataFrames
data = CSV.read("data.csv", DataFrame)
first(data, 5)
```
:::

## Inline Content Switching

You can also use content switching inline. For example, you might want to use
[pandas]{.content-switcher version="v2026.01"}
[readr]{.content-switcher version="v2.0"}
[CSV.jl]{.content-switcher version="v3.0"}
to read your data files. You can also use content switching inline. You can also use content switching inline. You can also use content switching inline. You can also use content switching inline.
